sprint_goal: Establish the core platform foundation by enabling new organizations to register and invite their first users, who can then log in.
epic_coverage: Platform Architecture & Tenant Provisioning,User Authentication & Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: Web-based organization registration flow; Admin user invitation system; Email/Password login for web and mobile
demo_objectives: Successfully register a new organization; Invite a new user via the Admin dashboard; Log in as the new user after they complete registration.
success_criteria: All acceptance criteria for US-001, US-004, and US-017 are met; End-to-end user onboarding flow is functional; All critical path tasks are complete.
risk_factors: Complexity of atomic registration logic (RISK-006); Potential for security flaws in tenant creation (RISK-001); Email deliverability for invitations.
mitigation_strategies: Allocate extra time for testing the `registerOrganization` function's rollback logic; Conduct security review of custom claims and Firestore rules; Use email capture service for testing.
integration_windows: API integration between web client and Cloud Functions on day 5-7.
burndown_target: Linear burndown, with low utilization providing significant buffer for foundational tasks.

sprint_goal: Launch the core mobile MVP for attendance tracking and supervisor review, and complete the user lifecycle management.
epic_coverage: Core Attendance Workflow,User Authentication & Lifecycle Management
key_deliverables: Mobile check-in with GPS and offline support; Supervisor dashboard with a real-time list of pending approvals; Admin user deactivation functionality.
demo_objectives: A Subordinate user checks in while offline, then syncs. A Supervisor views the pending record. An Admin deactivates a user account.
success_criteria: All acceptance criteria for US-028, US-037, and US-008 are met; Core mobile user journey is functional and stable; Offline sync is reliable.
risk_factors: Reliability of offline sync mechanism (RISK-005); Complexity of Supervisor security rules (RISK-001); Inconsistent GPS performance across devices.
mitigation_strategies: Extensive E2E testing of offline scenarios on physical devices; Rigorous testing of Firestore security rules in the emulator; Implement clear user feedback for GPS acquisition failures.
integration_windows: Mobile client integration with location services and offline cache throughout the sprint.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with buffer for mobile-specific testing and debugging.

sprint_goal: Deliver advanced administrative capabilities for reporting and data integration.
key_deliverables: Admin summary attendance reports (Daily, Weekly, Monthly); Automated data export to Google Sheets.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate the Admin dashboard showing summary reports with charts; Configure the Google Sheets integration and show data being automatically exported.
success_criteria: All acceptance criteria for US-059 and US-065 are met; Reports are performant and accurate; Google Sheets integration is secure and reliable.
risk_factors: Complexity of server-side OAuth 2.0 flow (RISK-003); Performance of server-side data aggregation at scale (RISK-006); Potential breaking changes in Google Sheets API.
mitigation_strategies: Security review of all token handling logic; Performance test the aggregation function with a large, seeded dataset; Implement robust error handling and alerting for the export function.
external_dependencies: Google Sheets API, Google Identity Platform
integration_windows: Integration with Google APIs for OAuth and Sheets export on day 3-7.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with focused effort on the high-complexity Google Sheets integration.
